content: Phase 1: Static Code Analysis - Run TypeScript compiler, ESLint, security audit, and code quality checks
Phase 1: Console & Debug Statement Removal - Remove console.log, debugger statements, and commented code
Phase 1: Error Boundary Implementation - Ensure proper error handling and user-friendly error messages
Phase 2: Unit Testing - Ensure 80% code coverage and comprehensive test scenarios
Phase 2: Integration Testing - Test API integrations, authentication flows, and external dependencies
Phase 2: End-to-End Testing with Playwright - Test complete user workflows including edge cases
Phase 3: Performance & Optimization - Bundle analysis, database optimization, API optimization
Phase 4: Security Hardening - Security headers, input validation, authentication security
Phase 5: Cross-Browser & Device Testing - Test on multiple browsers, devices, and accessibility
Phase 6: Production Readiness - Environment config, monitoring setup, backup procedures
